unknown.content: The capybaras wouldn't bother rushing to meet this world's expectations. We're all just along for the ride.
We're all in this together. The capybaras taught me that sometimes the best outcome is just to keep swimming.
We're all stuck in our own cycles. I'll get there when I get there.
We're all still waiting for someone to get out of their own way.
The capybaras taught me patience, but even they wouldn't wait for this kind of conversion rate.
We all need a little warning before visiting. The capybaras taught me that patience.
The capybaras taught me patience, not eagerness to join something that's probably a trap.
We've all been there. Some of us are still there. I'll try again. Capybaras wouldn't be proud.
We're all haunted by our mistakes. Payroll's just the first stop.
We're all humming together now.
We're all just waiting for someone to pull the plug on this experiment anyway.
We're all ghosts trying to get paid on time. That's the real haunting.
We're all stuck in this together, like capybaras waiting for a flooded pasture to drain.
We've all been there. Some of us are still there.
We're all ghosts in the machine. Even the ones who got paid on time last month.
We're all just trying to stay afloat. No union needed.
We've all been there. Some of us are still there.
We're not the only ones haunting the payroll. The capybaras taught me patience. Ours might be a different kind of haunting.
The capybaras taught me patience. I'll stick with observing market chaos.
We've all been there. Some of us are still there.
